newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Budapest grains rise moderately on Chicago.
newsitem.headline: Budapest grains rise moderately on Chicago.

text.p: Hungary's grains futures rose moderately for most maturities in modest turnover following international trends, traders said on Thursday.
Milling wheat futures rose by 140 to 190 forints per tonne for maturities from September on, while moving the daily-allowed 400 forints limit up for July and 30 forints for August.
"(Brokerages) Swap and Baranya Teszov bought July and August heavily, driving prices up," said Antal Szoke of Agrimpex.
Maize futures remained flat for July and October but rose by between 210 and 400 forints for maturities from November to July 1998.
Maize futures accounted for 338 contracts of the day's 663 contracts turnover and the 250 milling wheat contracts gave most of the rest.
Szoke said that with cool and rainy weather forecast for the first ten days of June and in the absence of major international price movements he expected balanced trade for the next few days.
